bibl.title: Merchant Networks in the Greek World: The Impact of Rome.
bibl.note: Contribution to a conference held in Rethymno, Crete, 26-28 May 2006. - Introduction. - Agents of the Roman State: Contractors (Publicani); - Soldiers and Veterans; - The Imperial Familia. - Private Individuals: Roman Social Institutions; - Roman Associations (Collegia); - Roman Business and Banking. - Conclusions. - Uses some papyrological evidence. - Also published in: MHR 22 (2007) pp. 309-320.

bibl.title: Greek and Roman Networks in the Mediterranean.

bibl.seg: Rathbone Dominic, Merchant Networks in the Greek World: The Impact of Rome.
Irad Malkin, Christy Constantakopoulou and Katerina Panagopoulou (Edd.), Greek and Roman Networks in the Mediterranean (London - New York, 2009) pp. 299-310.

Contribution to a conference held in Rethymno, Crete, 26-28 May 2006. - Introduction. - Agents of the Roman State: Contractors (Publicani); - Soldiers and Veterans; - The Imperial Familia. - Private Individuals: Roman Social Institutions; - Roman Associations (Collegia); - Roman Business and Banking. - Conclusions. - Uses some papyrological evidence. - Also published in: MHR 22 (2007) pp. 309-320.
